document.masterDocTitle: Notes on Lycocerus kiontochananus (Pic, 1921) and description of two new species of Lycocerus Gorham from China (Coleoptera, Cantharidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Notes on Lycocerus kiontochananus (Pic, 1921) and description of two new species of Lycocerus Gorham from China (Coleoptera, Cantharidae)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–4. Habitus, dorsal view: 1. Holotype of
Cantharis kiontochanana Pic, 1921
; 2. Holotype of
Lycocerus kejvali Švihla, 2004
; 3. Holotype of
Cantharis perroudi Pic, 1937
; 4. Holotype of
C. perroudi
var. atropygidialis Pic, 1937
. 1, 3–4. female; 2. male.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material examined.
Cantharis kiontochanana
: Holotype ♀ ( MNHN ): [p]“Kiautschau \ China ”, [h]“ kiontochanana \ Pic”, [h]“ Athemus \ kiontochananus \ (Pic) \ det. W. Wittmer”, [p]“ HOLOTYPUS ”. The right antenna and left antennomeres III–XI of the holotype are missing.

Lycocerus kejvali
: Holotype ♂ ( NMPC ): [p]“ CHINA ,
17 . – 22 . VI.
\ Shaanxi prov. 1991 \ Hua Shan peak env. \ 100 km E of Xi’an \ Z. Kejval lgt.”, [p]“ HOLOTYPUS \ Lycocerus \ kejvali sp.n. \ V. Švihla det. 2003 ”. The holotype is in good condition.

Distribution. China ( Tianjin , Shandong, Henan, Shaanxi, Gansu, Hubei).

Remarks. The aedeagus photos of
L. kiontochananus
provided by
Wittmer ( 1995 )
are actually of
L. nigrigenus
Y. Yang & X. Yang, 2013
. Furthermore, based on the examination of the types and a series of additional specimens including both sexes,
L. kejvali
Švihla, 2004
is considered to be a junior synonym of
L. kiontochananus
. Here we follow the description of this species for the male by
Švihla ( 2004 )
, and make a supplementary description for the characters of female different from those of male.
